post_text: Nice spotlight on a strong relationship with GHM. Thank you for the generous donation...there is no such thing as a small donation. Every donation looms large to our mission and our youth!! Thank you Rob and Michelle for making this happen!!
shared_text:
GHM Insurance Agency
June 4 at 1:39 PM ·

Today GHM presenting Good Will-Hinckley with a check to help with programing.

Historically, Good Will-Hinckley has been a home to youth facing complex academic, social, behavioral and emotional challenges. Before going to Good Will, they may have lacked sufficient support at home and/or in school. Our 1,000 plus acre campus served children and young adults ages 11 through 21. The campus also has the LC Bates Museum, a Carnegie Library and a MOFGA certified organic farm

Just recently, Good Will has formed the first charter school in Maine that focuses on agriculture, sustainability, forestry, workforce skills training and independent living. We offer a unique high school experiences for the active, real-world learner.

The legacy that George Walter Hinckley started will continue with a new focus on project-based, theme-oriented learning that will prepare students to live successful lives as they continue their education and career training. To learn more about the Maine Academy of Natural Sciences please visit them at http://means.gwh.org.

#PartnershipIsPowerful

Fun Fact Friday!

Back in the 1800s two men named George had an unexpected meeting and were instrumental in benefiting many young lives! These two people were Reverend George Hinckley and Dr. George Averill.

The young lives that have and continue to benefit from their meeting are a part of Good Will-Hinckley and Lee Academy.

This week GWH's President & ED, Rob Moody, along with a few GWH Board members visited Lee Academy. Pictured below is the dining hall cabin that was given to Good Will-Hinckley, then purchased by Dr. Averill and gifted to Lee Academy.

Be on the lookout for a future blog that talks more about this chance meeting between Rev. Hinckley and Dr. Averill and how their connection has made a lifelong impact!

✋😊✋ Good Will-Hinckley ~ Fairfield, Maine

I was TRULY HONORED to have been asked by the Kindergarten thru 12th Grade Students at Good Will-Hinckley for "High-Fives" and "Knuckle-Bumps" after my Presentation.

Good Will-Hinckley is an AMAZING Campus: In 1889, the Reverend George Walter Hinckley founded a place he called Good - Will Hinckley with the sole purpose and mission of helping young people in need of a home and a helping hand. What began as a Home-School-Farm, where Students in need lived, worked and received an education, has grown over the years in both scope and breadth into the haven it is today - helping so many Youth with such diverse needs. Check out their programs on their website. They DO LIVE their Mission to "Change Lives!"

Good Will-Hinckley Website: https://www.gwh.org

SPECIAL THANKS to:
Good Will-Hinckley President & Executive Director Robert Moody for inviting me to speak to your Students.
